headerDisplay: This plugin provides contact sensors to automate sun protection. Sensors are opened (breached) when the sun is in a given section of the sky (azimuth) and optionally if an [OpenWeather API key](https://openweathermap.org/api) is provided when the sun is above the horizon and the sky is not overcast.
footerDisplay: For help or in case of issues please visit the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Krillle/homebridge-sunlight/issues). Based on [homebridge-sunsensors](https://github.com/mfkrause/homebridge-sunsensors).

apikey.title: OpenWeather API Key
apikey.description: If API key is provided, sunhsine is reported only during daylight times when sky is not overcast

sun.title: OpenWeather API minimum sun threshold
sun.description: If API key is provided, this value set minimum sun threshold

overcast.title: OpenWeather API maximum overcast threshold
overcast.description: If API key is provided, this value set maximum overcast threshold

sensors.title: Sensors
sensors.description: Define contact sensors for one or more sections of the sky, e.g. for windows looking to different directions. Direction is specified in degrees of compass: 0° North, 90° East, 180° South, 270° West. To define overlaps you can use values between -360° and 0° as well as 360° and 720°.

name.title: Sensor Name
name.description: Homekit display name of the sensor

lowerThreshold.title: Lower Threshold
lowerThreshold.description: Left side of sky section within which the sensor should activate

upperThreshold.title: Upper Threshold
upperThreshold.description: Right side of sky section within which the sensor should activate

lowerAltitudeThreshold.title: Lower Altitude Threshold
lowerAltitudeThreshold.description: Lower altitude threshold within which the sensor should activate

upperAltitudeThreshold.title: Upper Altitude Threshold
upperAltitudeThreshold.description: Upper altitude threshold within which the sensor should activate
